sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The daughter of a prominent Russian nationalist and ally of President Vladimir Putin has died after a car exploded in the outskirts of Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's President Zelensky warns that Russia might be planning an attack as Kiev prepares for its upcoming 31st Independence Day exactly six months to the day since the war began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The heart of a former Portuguese king and the liberator of Brazil will go on display in Porto before it goes on exhibition in Brasilia to commemorate 200 years of independence.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The daughter of an influential Russian nationalist and ally,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Vladimir Putin, has died in a car explosion outside Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Daria Dugina, the 29-year-old daughter of political theorist Alexander Dugin, was driving an SUV when a bomb planted in the car detonated.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: She died at the scene and authorities are investigating the incident.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian media is reporting that the car belonged to Dugin's father, who is a strong supporter of the war in Ukraine and who's often referred to as Putin's brain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: No suspect has been identified so far, but some people, including pro-Kremlin officials and the head of the self-proclaimed Russian-controlled Donetsk People's Republic, have blamed Ukraine for the explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Maria Zakharova said on Telegram that authorities are investigating if Ukraine is connected to the explosion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: However, Kyiv has denied the accusation, saying that it is not a terrorist state and was not involved in the bombing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Dugin is a strong proponent of the Russian world concept, which calls for the restoration of Russian power and traditional values. Both Dugin and his daughter have been sanctioned by Western powers. Ukraine is preparing to celebrate its independence day on August 24, the same day that marks six months since the beginning of Russia's full-scale invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In contrast with the usual military parades, this year Kyiv will be exhibiting destroyed Russian military equipment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: In his late-night address on Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy warned that Russia might take the opportunity to launch a brutal attack. We should be aware that Russia may try to do something particularly disgusting and particularly violent this week, he said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: That's our enemy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Russia has done something disgusting and violent every week during the last six months, constantly.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the president also said the occupation of Crimea is temporary and that Ukraine is returning.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: His message follows an alleged drone attack on the headquarters for Moscow's Black Sea fleet in Sevastopol.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, the Russian appointed governor claims the drone was shot down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Russia's Army 2022 forum is in full swing, and the people attending the event are expressing their support for the war in Ukraine, despite six months of fighting and Western sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The event is in part a way for the country to show off its extensive weapons catalog.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: A salesman at the forum says, I think we will win,. I think we will come to a situation where we will reverse Gorbachev's illegitimate decision and go back to the border of 1945. That's the only way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: There is no other way. Another person claims that I think our people will win after all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Peace will be restored between Russia and Ukraine because we are friendly countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: I think that sooner or later it was necessary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Better a horrible end than a horror without an end, says an IT specialist.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This forum is both a propaganda tool and a way to promote Russia's weapons internationally.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Sales of military equipment are an important source of revenue for Moscow. This year, Russia says it exported around 5.4 billion euros worth of arms and it plans to sell a similar amount in the second half of 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Russian Ministry of Defense announced that it will sign contracts worth more than 8 billion euros this week. More than 1,900 workers at the UK's largest container port, Felixstowe, are set to walk out on Sunday for the start of an eight-day strike. The action parallels thousands of other workers across the UK, campaigning for better pay as the cost of living continues to rise. On Saturday, only one in five UK trains are expected to run, as more than 45,000 workers call for better pay and job security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: There is an offer on the table from Network Rail, which is 50% of our members.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: It's a three-year pay deal at 8%, and that will have to cover next year as well as this year and last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Inflation this week on the retail price index was 12.3.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So if we accepted that pay offer, we would be getting about a quarter of next year's inflation, which is likely to be 15 or 16 percent. So our members aren't prepared to accept that. The strikes have received mixed responses from the general public, as most of London's underground tube stations will not run because of a separate strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the disruptions have put a stop to some weekend travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: because of a separate strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And the disruptions have put a stop to some weekend travel.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Yes, I do feel sympathy for them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: However, there's got to be another way, because the disruption is phenomenal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All over the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It means you can't get anywhere.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And some argue that the strikes will affect some more than others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I'm glad that people have the chance to make that point, but of course it's us suffering and not the guy going to work in their limos and black cap.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The strike comes as inflation in the UK has reached 10.1 percent, a 40-year high.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: An increasing number of people are struggling to pay for the rising cost of food and energy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Other workers, such as lawyers, British telecom staff and postal workers, have also announced walkouts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Tension in the Netherlands coalition this week has been simmering.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's after Christian Democrat leader Wopke Hoekstra was quoted in an interview as saying the country's goals of reducing nitrogen emissions by 50% by 2030 is not sacred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This, however, is in direct contradiction to the ambitious government plans agreed by Uxtra's party. We have to restart the process Uxtra told the morning newspaper AD. Farmers have to become an ally again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One thing is not up for discussion. Nature restoration is necessary. That requires a 50% reduction. The CDA does not want to pass the problems on to the next generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But farmers also need to be able to earn a fair living.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Arriving at his office on Friday, Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte said Uxter's quotes were a shock to everyone in the coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: It's an interview that's raised a few eyebrows here and there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: For the Minister of Nature and Nitrogen, Christian van der Waal, her response was less casual.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: CHRISTIAN VAN DER WAAL, Minister of Nature and Nitrogen The coalition agreement stands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It says that we will achieve the goals in 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's my task.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That's what I'm going for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And then one of the cabinet members says that it's not a given.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But at the same time, they have also signed the coalition agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The target has sparked heated debate and protests among farmers in the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: This weekend, farmers parked along the course of the Spanish cycling race La Vuelta, which the Netherlands is hosting a touring stage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Protests have been going on all summer, with farmers feeling the objectives are unrealistic to match the Netherlands' production demands, and in turn, fair earnings for farmers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: China has declared its first drought emergency of the year. This community reservoir in Chongqing has all but evaporated. The giant Yangtze River serves as a lifeline for farms and businesses in the area, but it too is disappearing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This farmer says he is now pumping groundwater, but it is not enough to keep his crops alive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Authorities say an estimated one million people in rural areas will face water shortages.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Porto in Portugal is hosting an unusual two-day exhibition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The heart of the 19th century monarch, Dom Pedro IV, is currently on display.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: On Monday, the royal organ, which has been preserved inside an urn, will travel to Brazil with a team of experts to feature in the country's national day celebrations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Known to some Brazilians as the soldier king, he fled Portugal during the French invasion and declared Brazil independent in 1822.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A visitor to the exhibition says, I think it's fantastic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's fabulous after two centuries to have the heart of a person who loved Porto so much.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the Portuguese tried to end Brazil's autonomy, Dom Pedro defeated the armies loyal to Lisbon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Unable to deal with the problems within Brazil's parliament, he abdicated in 1831.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, he is hailed as a key figure in advancing representative forms of government in both countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The heart is scheduled to return to Porto on September 8th.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian boxer Oleksandr Usyk says he fought for his homeland as he unraveled a national flag signed by soldiers after he retained his world heavyweight titles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Oleksandr Usyk, Ukrainian boxer He was very important for my country, for my team and especially for me. И лично для меня. Потому что я боксировал за всю страну.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: И за полмирия. as a symbol for his people. Usyk is already considered a national hero by many in Ukraine, where he served in the army amid the country's war with Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He beat British boxer Anthony Joshua, who missed out in a bid to regain his status as a heavyweight champion.
